comment_body: https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-sairedis/pull/1369
you can add tests in the same PR, you dont need extra pr just for tests

> you can add tests in the same PR, you dont need extra pr just for tests

Yes, but I'm not sure whether my changes will fix this coverage issue, Meanwhile, I feel I don't have the write permission for this PR.
So, just raise a draft PR and ask @saiarcot895 to pick up my change.

im not sure whether we should have each specific parameter for specific SAI to add expected libraries, or to add EXTRA_LIBSAI_LDFLAGS in the console before typing make, so configure should pick that up from environment set variables

> im not sure whether we should have each specific parameter for specific SAI to add expected libraries, or to add EXTRA_LIBSAI_LDFLAGS in the console before typing make, so configure should pick that up from environment set variables


I understand that this PR is not an elegant way to deal with the dash SAI, and it seems like a temporary fix. There are many codes in sonic-buildimage that depend on vs. It's difficult to make the vs support dual SAI or create a new sku in a short time. However, I hope we will eventually have a new SKU like virtual DPU.
There are no temporary fixes, it will propagate to scripts and stay forever since different versions will not be compatible in the future
please satisfy code coverage test

Hi @kcudnik 
can you help to merge it?
thanks
@kcudnik can you please merge this PR?

@xumia Looks like that pipeline got disabled because it didn't get classified. Would you be able to help with classifying that pipeline and re-enabling it? I tried to do it, but couldn't find the link to do so.

> @xumia Looks like that pipeline got disabled because it didn't get classified. Would you be able to help with classifying that pipeline and re-enabling it? I tried to do it, but couldn't find the link to do so.

/azp run Azure.sonic-sairedis
Azure Pipelines successfully started running 1 pipeline(s).

> > @xumia Looks like that pipeline got disabled because it didn't get classified. Would you be able to help with classifying that pipeline and re-enabling it? I tried to do it, but couldn't find the link to do so.
> 
> It is good now, right? I do nothing.

@xumia This is for the pipeline at https://dev.azure.com/mssonic/build/_build?definitionId=465&_a=summary (building the `lib-packages` target of sonic-buildimage and publishing those artifacts). It was disabled back in December because the pipeline didn't appear to be assigned to a service. To unblock this cherry-pick PR, I manually re-enabled the pipeline, triggered a build for master and 202311 branch, and then disabled the pipeline after the builds finished.

Is that pipeline now assigned to a service? If so, it can be re-enabled, I think.

Please add description to PR
@kcudnik can we merge the PR?
Is the root case already known? Was it double join?

Double join could be an explanation. More likely scenario is that m_taskThread is not joinable because after MdioIpcServer constructor startMdioThread() was not called or because startMdioThread() failed. @kenneth-arista can provide more test details.

> Double join could be an explanation. More likely scenario is that m_taskThread is not joinable because after MdioIpcServer constructor startMdioThread() was not called or because startMdioThread() failed. @kenneth-arista can provide more test details.

Can you investigate which exactly scenario is that ?

> > Double join could be an explanation. More likely scenario is that m_taskThread is not joinable because after MdioIpcServer constructor startMdioThread() was not called or because startMdioThread() failed. @kenneth-arista can provide more test details.
> 
> Can you investigate which exactly scenario is that ?

Unfortunately, I don't have all the logs when the problem occurred before integrating Jiahua's patch. Prior to the patch, I would often seen several syncd core files after each full sonic-mgmt test runs. I suspect these crashes are triggered in tests involving reboot.
I recall that a syncd crash was observed once during sonic-mgmt `override_config_table` tests.
This patch will address both cases of double join and thread not starting properly.
@jiahua-wang  - please update the branch? thanks

@saksarav-nokia Please add the test details too .. To confirm the logs are no more coming in the sairedis logs

@judyjoseph , i tested the fix in both SUP and LC and monitored the sairedis logs, these logs are not getting logged.  Without this change, the sairedis logs used to fill very quickly and log rotate rotates the sairedis files and many files will be present with in few hours. But with this fix, only very few sairedis log files are present and the events are created only during syncd init and not the regular polling events.
@judyjoseph could we have an ADO for cherry pick?

@kcudnik I have a quick question here -- these attributes  SAI_PORT_ATTR_FABRIC_ATTACHED, SAI_PORT_ATTR_FABRIC_ATTACHED_SWITCH_ID & SAI_PORT_ATTR_FABRIC_ATTACHED_PORT_INDEX -- are specific to T2 not applicable to T0/T1. Do we need to add any T2 specific check for these attributes inSkipRecordAttrContainer::SkipRecordAttrContainer() ?
im not ware of any specific platform attributes, and i dont have enough knowledge here, can you ask @saksarav-nokia
Not sure about that, could you ask author of that enable fabric code ? I didn't put that there
